Description: Fragment of sofa rim with turn to floor of East Greek pottery plate; light groove at edge of rim, and ridge at join with floor. Interior slipped white: edge of rim glazed; volute frieze with large interstitial drops on top; band of small dots against ridge; ridge and floor as far as preserved glazed; Edge of rim glazed, underside wholly worn.
Production place: Made in: North Ionia (Compare a piece from Berezan, analytically assigned to Klazomenai(?) (R. Posamentir, 'Funde aus Berezan in St. Petersburg II' Istanbuler Mitteiilungen 57 (2007) 188, fig. 2,3).)
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 3)
Paspalas 2006 / The Non-figured Wares from the Anglo-Turkish Excavations at Old Smyrna (p.94 fig.2, No.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.145)
